Package com.github.actionfx.core.annotation

Annotation Type AFXSubscribe

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Documented
@Target(METHOD)
public @interface AFXSubscribe
    Allows a simple event mechanism and a loose couple of ActionFX controllers. Annotated methods are invoked, when an event of type #value() is emitted through ActionFX.publishEvent(Object).

    In case the annotated method has a method argument that is of the same type than value(), then the emitted event is used as method argument to that method.

    Please note that methods annotated by AFXSubscribe can also have additional method argument, that are e.g. annotated by AFXControlValue.

    Author:
    koster

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element Description
      java.lang.Class<?> value
      The emitted type that the annotated method shall be invoked on.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      boolean async
      Optional flag that determines, whether the annotated method shall be executed in an asynchronous fashion.
      int order
      An optional order that can be specified to define the order of execution of the annotated method, in case more than one method have been subscribed to the given value()

    • Element Detail

      • value

        java.lang.Class<?> value
        The emitted type that the annotated method shall be invoked on.
        Returns:
        the type the is listened to

      • order

        int order
        An optional order that can be specified to define the order of execution of the annotated method, in case more than one method have been subscribed to the given value()
        Returns:
        the order, default is 1
        Default:
        1

      • async

        boolean async
        Optional flag that determines, whether the annotated method shall be executed in an asynchronous fashion. When set to true, the annotated method is not executed inside the JavaFX-thread, but in its own thread in order not to block the JavaFX thread. In case that UI components need to be updated in the method, the update itself needs to be run with Platform.runLater(Runnable).
        Returns:
        true,if method execution shall be performed from a new thread, false, if the method shall be executed synchronously inside the JavaFX thread. Default is false.
        Default:
        false
